newsitem.title: USA: Search mounted for National Guard plane in Minn..
newsitem.headline: Search mounted for National Guard plane in Minn..

text.p: Rescuers searched dense woods in northern Minnesota Wednesday for an Air National Guard fighter jet and its pilot that authorities believe crashed.
The F-16 disappeared while practicing "night intercept" manoeuvres with three other planes about 50 miles north of Duluth Tuesday evening.
The crash was apparently not witnessed by anyone and the plane went down over a "very deserted, densely wooded area," a spokesman for the 148th Fighter Wing of the National Guard said.
"We are slowly eliminating the areas where the plane could have gone down," he said.
The plane did not have an automatic distress signal, but if the pilot had ejected that would have triggered a rescue beacon, the spokesman said.
The pilot was not identified pending notification of his next of kin.
